content.description: Like Sonic Youth in Clear Creek Canyon, the Sonic Crack is a pretty unique feature.  It is different in the sense that it is an overhung dihedral/crack on an arete.  SDS on two good holds and move up using the crack only.  Bust out of the dihedral to a large bucket and bulbous feature.  Hand/foot match on the bulb and slap up top for the slopey top-out.  I would say best warm-up or beginner problem in the park, and would easily be worth 4 stars if it wasn't for the boulder right behind the problem. GET ON THIS!
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads for the ground. 1 or 2 pads to protect the back breaking boulder.
content.location: Sit start in the pit between blocks.

content.description: Sit-start with hands matched on big knobby jug to the right. Use right arete and face features straight up to slopey top out. Â Big block low and right is off.
content.location: Facing Sonic Youth Boulder from the trail, this problem is on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: The Sonic Youth boulder sits peacefully in the shade just off the trail when heading out to the large rock outcropping. It has two unique overhung problems that are difficult to protect with pads. The stone cleans up nicely and is very solid.
